snippet: Of the runners slated to compete in the New York City Marathon, the contenders — and those hoping to join them — felt the biggest financial loss.
abstract: Elite runners who had planned to compete in New York City Marathon face significant financial loss because of race's cancellation due to Hurricane Sandy; loss could amount to as much as half a year's income for many such runners.
lead_paragraph: Of the runners slated to compete in the New York City Marathon, the contenders — and those hoping to join them — felt the biggest financial loss.

headline.seo: No N.Y.C. Marathon Means No Prize Money
headline.main: Contenders Miss Out on Chance for Big Payday
headline.print_headline: Contenders Miss Out on Chance for Big Payday
